section.title: XML Validation
section.para: Each docbook XML file starts with a DTD or XSD declaration. This will validate it's structure. Most authoring tools will add this for you.

important.title: A DTD or XSD declaration is mandatory
important.para: If the XML file does not contain a DTD (DOCTYPE) or a XSD (xsi:schemaLocation) declaration, you must add the correct declaration to the XML file.

section.title: DTD validation
section.para: With DocBook 4.5, use DTD validation and the non-namespaced styles (for example jbossorg-docbook-xslt).
The DOCTYPE declaration is located at the very beginning of a file. For example, a <section> DOCTYPE declaration will look similar to the following sample.
section.programlisting:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<!DOCTYPE section PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DocBook XML V4.5//EN" "docbookV4.5/docbookx.dtd" [
]>
section.para: For <chapter> XML files, change the DOCTYPE declaration to chapter.

section.title: XSD validation
section.para: With DocBook 5, use XSD validation and the namespaced styles (for example jbossorg-docbook-xslt-ns). Publican might not support docbook 5 yet.
